title: IBM Cloud docs
introduction: The platform is built to support your needs whether it's working only in the public cloud or taking advantage of a multicloud deployment model.

section_recommended.title: Navigating the IBM Cloud console
section_recommended.description: The IBM Cloud console is a user interface that you use to manage all your IBM Cloud resources.

section_recommended.title: IBM Cloud prerequisites
section_recommended.description: The prerequisites for using the IBM Cloud platform are limited, but we do have a few.

section_recommended.title: Service and infrastructure by region
section_recommended.description: Check out the regions and data centers that IBM Cloud products are available.

section_videos.title: Learn how to navigate through the IBM Cloud console

tiles.title: IBM Cloud Code Engine is supported as an app deployment type
tiles.description: IBM Cloud Code Engine is now supported as a application deployment type when you use a starter kit in the IBM Cloud console.

tiles.title: Managing user login sessions
tiles.description: You can customize the duration of working sessions for user's on your account.

tiles.title: Controlling access to resources by using tags
tiles.description: You can now create tags to control access to your resources and your team's projects can grow without requiring updates to your IAM policies.
